'''Robert Edward''' "'''Bob'''" '''Brookmeyer''' (December 19, 1929 â€“ December 15, 2011) was an American jazz [[valve trombone|valve]] trombonist, [[Jazz piano|pianist]], arranger, and composer. Born in [[Kansas City, Missouri]], Brookmeyer first gained widespread public attention as a member of [[Gerry Mulligan]]'s quartet from 1954 to 1957. He later worked with [[Jimmy Giuffre]], before rejoining Mulligan's Concert Jazz Band. He received eight [[Grammy Award]] nominations during his lifetime.
